title: Quiz 8: The Child-to-Child (CtC) Approach
topicName: Principles & Practice of Health Promotion I
description: Specifically assess knowledge of the Child-to-Child approach, its pillars, and implementation steps.

questions.question: Who first introduced the Child-to-Child (CtC) approach in 1978?
questions.explanation: David Morley introduced CtC following the Alma-Ata Declaration.
questions.hint: It was in preparation for the International Year of the Child.

questions.question: What are the two theoretical pillars of the Child-to-Child approach? (Select 2)
questions.explanation: CtC rests on Popular Education (learning from each other) and Child Participation (rights/agency).

questions.question: Correctly order the 6 Steps of the Child-to-Child approach:
questions.hint: Start with forming the group and end with reflection.

questions.question: The CtC approach views children as merely 'adults in training' who cannot influence solutions.
questions.explanation: False. It recognizes children as people who can form opinions, participate in decisions, and influence solutions.
questions.hint: Think about the pillar of 'Child Participation'.

questions.question: In Step 4 ('Find Out More'), what is the primary activity?

options.text: Planning how to research the selected issue

questions.explanation: Step 4 involves gathering accurate information about the chosen issue before acting.

questions.question: Popular education is an educational model in which there are no '___BLANK___' and everyone teaches and everyone learns.
questions.explanation: Popular education flattens the hierarchyâ€”everyone contributes knowledge.

questions.question: Match the CtC step with its purpose:

pairs.right: Getting to know each other / building trust

questions.explanation: Group Work = Foundation; Choose = Decision; Action = Implementation; Think = Evaluation.
questions.hint: Match the name to the activity.

questions.question: The CtC approach was developed to enable school-aged children to pass health messages to whom?
questions.explanation: It empowers children to help themselves, their peers, their younger siblings, and families.
questions.hint: Other children they play with or live with.

questions.question: Which international convention recognizes that children have the right to participate as full members of society?

options.text: UN Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC)

questions.explanation: The UN CRC firmly roots the principle of child participation.

questions.question: CtC projects aim to empower children to identify problems in their community and work to solve them.
questions.explanation: True. It involves children in the development process of their own communities.
